Your characteristic method of attack on science in general (and evolution in
 particular) is to lay down a creeping barrage of bafflegab that nobody has the
 time and patience to examine and to refute. You continuously claim, despite
 every effort made to corrrect you, that scientific rationalism gives an 
 inadequate and/or mistaken account of the natural world. 
 
 O.K. Here's my challenge: Without hiding behind your apparatus of citations,
 "authorities" etc. (whether popes, bishops, saints, or early Christian fathers) 
 please state in a form that even a scientist can understand, your "proofs" of
 the existence of God.
 
 In case you pretend that my opening remarks are just an ad hominem that
 are intended to damage you, I wish to emphasise that I intend them only
 as a description of your modus operandi.

There's an old saying Alan (I'm gettin a lot mileage out of these cliches :) ) -
 
 Be careful what you wish for. emoticon_wow :p
 
 Waxy

Monty, I've got another question-
 
 Where on earth do you find all of those quotes? 
 
 Do you have access to some special website? 
 
 How do you search for them?
 
 How do you pick out the part of the paper/book/essay etc... that you intend to quote? 
 
 Obviously you haven't read all of these sources beginning to end, so how do you select the quote?
 
 How do you place it in context of the overall works of the author?
 
 Just curious.
 
 Waxy

 Waxy

 
 lol. good questions, I have wondered about this myself.
 
 -Mach
You will notice that Monty tends not to respond to posts like these...
